page.title: 06FARMING IN WOOLSTON/THELWALL
page.content:
There is very little useful farmland in this area.
What useful land there is lies either at the North Eastern or South Eastern edges of the block. The best land is found in the former area. Both root crops and cereals can be found growing on land bordering the road from Warrington to Manchester.
In the South the land can best be described as{rough pasture.}A number of fields are given over to grazing for horses. In fact there are a couple of Riding Schools in this area.
As has been stated before the majority of undeveloped land in this block is of little or no agricultural use.
